<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 325, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 586, 595, 601]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 601, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 630, 608, 646]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 646, 756, 661]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 661, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 598, 102]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 301, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a circle with radius \(r\) cm and centre \(O\). Points \(A\) and \(B\) lie on the circle and \(ABCD\) is a rectangle. Angle \(AOB = 2\theta\) radians and \(AD = r\) cm.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 348, 156, 367]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 348, 658, 367]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 348, 920, 367]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 715, 92]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
A point moves along the curve in such a way that the \(x\)-coordinate is increasing at a constant rate of 0.04 units per second. Find the rate of change of the \(y\)-coordinate when \(x = 4\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 83, 660, 288]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 306, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the straight line \(x + y = 5\) intersecting the curve \(y = \frac{4}{x}\) at the points \(A\) (1, 4) and \(B\) (4, 1). Find, showing all necessary working, the volume obtained when the shaded region is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 349, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The first two terms of an arithmetic progression are 16 and 24. Find the least number of terms of the progression which must be taken for their sum to exceed 20 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A geometric progression has a first term of 6 and a sum to infinity of 18. A new geometric progression is formed by squaring each of the terms of the original progression. Find the sum to infinity of the new progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 102, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 782, 92]]<|/det|>
Relative to an origin \(O\), the position vectors of three points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) are given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[180, 100, 816, 123]]<|/det|>
\[\overrightarrow{OA} = 3\mathbf{i} + p\mathbf{j} - 2p\mathbf{k},\quad \overrightarrow{OB} = 6\mathbf{i} + (p + 4)\mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k}\quad \mathrm{and}\quad \overrightarrow{OC} = (p - 1)\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + q\mathbf{k},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 131, 348, 149]]<|/det|>
where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 163, 154, 180]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 161, 670, 180]]<|/det|>
In the case where \(p = 2\), use a scalar product to find angle \(AOB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 180]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 74, 154, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 72, 685, 95]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
